<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Good morning. </strong>In today’s newsletter we try to make some sense of that crazy Merger Monday. Let us know if we succeed. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But first...if you’re looking for a podcast to help you pass the time in a plane/train/automobile today, we’ve got an excellent new episode to recommend. <div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
DEALS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/11/25/ebay-sells-stubhub-viagogo-massive-merger-monday?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
EBay Sells Tickets
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="stubhub turnstile " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTc0NzIzNTQ1LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">For newsletter writers, a Merger Monday on which companies <a href="https://markets.businessinsider.com/news/stocks/merger-monday-5-companies-announced-more-than-60-billion-deals-2019-11-1028715870?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">announce</a> more than $60 billion worth of deals is like when they close the door to the plane and your row is still empty. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">So where to start? Let’s go with the most under-the-radar deal of the day: eBay’s <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-ebay-divestiture/ebay-to-sell-ticketing-unit-stubhub-for-4-05-billion-idUSKBN1XZ1ME?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">sale</a> of online ticketing company StubHub to Swiss ticket reseller Viagogo for $4.1 billion cash.  </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Mama, I’m coming home </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Viagogo CEO Eric Baker <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2019/11/25/business/stubhub-viagogo-ebay-sale.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">cofounded</a> StubHub in 2000 while at Stanford business school. But after being <a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hNihWir9xzs&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">fired</a> by his business partner, Baker left to start Viagogo in 2006. The next year, StubHub sold to eBay for $310 million.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Baker may not recognize his baby. </strong>StubHub has become a huge player in the U.S. ticket market, doing $4.8 billion in ticket sales last year. In Q3, it accounted for <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/ebay-nears-deal-to-sell-stubhub-to-viagogo-for-roughly-4-billion-11574688756?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">about 14%</a> of eBay revenue. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But StubHub had been on the chopping block for months. In January, activist investors Starboard Value and Elliott Management <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/elliott-management-calls-for-ebay-to-shed-stubhub-classified-ads-business-11548166204?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">called on eBay</a> to sell its Classifieds business and StubHub. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Viagogo, you’re up</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The company is a force in the U.K. and continental Europe, offering tickets to popular sports like cricket, rugby, and soccer. But Viagogo keeps finding itself in a scrum of regulatory scrutiny. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Last November, the U.K.’s Competition and Markets Authority (CMA) secured a </span><span><a href="https://www.gov.uk/government/news/cma-secures-court-order-against-viagogo?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">court order</a></span><span> against Viagogo over concerns it was violating consumer protection law. CMA has since </span><span><a href="https://www.gov.uk/cma-cases/secondary-ticketing-websites?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">suspended preparations</a></span><span> for further court action after Viagogo satisfied its concerns. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Ahead of last year's World Cup in Russia, FIFA field a </span><span><a href="https://money.cnn.com/2018/06/08/news/companies/world-cup-fifa-ticket-resales/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">criminal complaint</a></span><span> against the company for “opaque and deceptive business conduct.” </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>Viagogo will need to become squeaky clean considering the market power it’s about to inherit with StubHub (moving <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2019/11/25/business/ebay-stubhub-viagogo-deal/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">hundreds of thousands</a> of tickets per day across 70+ countries). As for eBay, shedding StubHub is step 1 of 100 in resolving a yearslong identity crisis. </p>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
LUXURY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/11/25/meet-bernard-arnault-dealmaking-kingpin-luxury?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
LVMH Says Au Revoir, Bezos
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Louis Vuitton bag in Tiffany coloring" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTc0NzI1MTIzLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">An incomplete body of proof that the French are not known for subtlety: Camembert, Roquefort, and Bernard Arnault.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The one that won’t assail your tastebuds is the CEO, chairman, and biggest shareholder of LVMH, the world’s largest luxury conglomerate. Yesterday, Arnault <a href="https://www.ibtimes.com/bernard-arnault-emperor-luxury-has-tiffany-breakfast-2873077?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">brokered</a> the biggest-ever deal in luxury when LVMH agreed to buy Tiffany & Co. for $16.2 billion.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>With a post-Tiffany-deal </span><span><a href="https://www.cnn.com/2019/11/25/investing/bernard-arnault-worlds-richest-jeff-bezos-bill-gates/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">net worth</a></span><span> of more than $106 billion, Arnault is within striking distance of Jeff Bezos and Bill Gates for the title of the world’s richest person.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Money does seem to grow on trees when you’re “the godfather of the modern luxury industry,” <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2019/11/25/fashion/bernard-arnault-tiffany-lvmh.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">per the NYT</a>. LVMH is the parent to a whopping 75 brands, from Dior to Dom Pérignon. LVMH has 3x the market cap of its nearest rival, Kering, and it’s the No. 2 most valuable company in Europe behind Shell.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>Consider Tiffany a starter ring. With Arnault at the head and roughly <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2019/11/24/lvmh-reaches-deal-to-acquire-tiffany-for-16point3-billion.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">$50 billion</a> in annual revenue, LVMH has moats wide enough to 1) insulate it from potential economic ennui and 2) make mega-dealmaking the new norm.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">
<a href="https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2019%2F11%2F25%2Fmeet-bernard-arnault-dealmaking-kingpin-luxury" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">

</a><span>  </span>
<a href="https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=Money+does+seem+to+grow+on+trees+when+you%E2%80%99re+%E2%80%9Cthe+godfather+of+the+modern+luxury+industry%22&url=https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/11/25/meet-bernard-arnault-dealmaking-kingpin-luxury&via=MorningBrew" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">
<img alt="" style="display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e86574d1eb82.jpg">

<img alt="" style="display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e86576e04837.jpg">
</a><span>  </span>
<a href="/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection#" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">
<img alt="" style="display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e8657887c532.jpg">
</a>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
BROKERAGE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/11/25/schwabs-deal-td-ameritrade-invites-antitrust-scrutiny?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Schwab and TD May Have to Wait for Forever
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Charles Schwab <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2019/11/25/investing/charles-schwab-td-ameritrade/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">confirmed</a> Monday it’s buying fellow online brokerage TD Ameritrade for $26 billion. But <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/11/21/schwab-brokers-td-ameritrade-deal?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">making it official</a> brings hard questions: Where will we spend Thanksgiving? And will consumers suffer because of our union?</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Sure enough, the “behemoth” Schwab/Ameritrade deal is already generating antitrust chatter—after all, the new firm would have $5+ trillion in client assets.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Execs </span><span><a href="https://www.ft.com/content/fac8a498-0ca7-11ea-bb52-34c8d9dc6d84?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">quickly pointed out</a></span><span> that the combined entity would have ~11% of assets in the U.S. retail wealth management industry and only 6% of revenues. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>And the industry's race to no-fee trading is (theoretically) good for everyday consumers.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But this isn’t just about consumers. Schwab and TD Ameritrade both offer “custodian” services, such as record keeping, to registered investment advisers (RIAs). Schwab owns roughly <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/opinion/articles/2019-11-25/schwab-td-ameritrade-deal-raises-more-than-one-antitrust-concern?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">half the market</a>, and TD Ameritrade would tack on another 15%–20% share, per KBW.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>You can <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-11-21/schwab-ameritrade-faces-tough-antitrust-scrutiny-analysts-say?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">count on</a> antitrust regulators looking into the deal. But the $26 billion question is whether <a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/business/2019/11/25/charles-schwab-will-acquire-td-ameritrade-creating-wealth-management-goliath-with-trillion-assets/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">officials decide</a> Schwab/Ameritrade’s competition is online brokers or giant Wall St. banks.</p>

<img alt="" style="display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e86576e04837.jpg">
</a><span>  </span>

</a>
</td>
</tr>
</table>

</td>
</tr>
</table>
</th>
</tr>
</table>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SUSTAINABILITY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/11/25/allbirds-amazon-public-private-label-feud?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Allbirds, Amazon, and the Public Private Label Feud
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Allbirds shoes" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTc0NzIzNTE5LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Allbirds</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><em>“We are flattered at the similarities that your private label shoe shares with ours.” </em></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In an <a href="https://medium.com/@joeyzwillinger/dear-mr-bezos-e691f6d6d705?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">open letter</a> to Jeff Bezos yesterday, Joey Zwillinger, cofounder of sustainable shoe startup Allbirds, called out Amazon for <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-11-25/allbirds-calls-out-amazon-for-mimicking-95-wool-sneaker?srnd=markets-vp&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">copying</a> every part of Allbirds’s Wool Runner shoe—every part but the sustainability.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The backstory: </strong>Amazon recently <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2019/11/19/business/allbirds-amazon-scrutiny/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">released</a> the Canal Street version of Allbirds’s Wool Runner for less than half the price. It swears that “offering products inspired by the trends to which customers are responding is a common practice across the retail industry.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">But Allbirds says something’s missing: </strong>Amazon isn't using the open-sourced, sustainable tech Allbirds has shared with 100+ brands.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Zwillinger to Bezos: “You can use it. We </span><span><em>want </em></span><span>you to use it...With the help of your immense scale, the cost of this material will come down for all users.”</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>Trying to convince Amazon and its sprawling collection of 1,000+ private label successes to adopt Allbirds’s sustainable habits won’t be easy, but neither is avoiding a tech bro joke in an Allbirds story.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">
<a href="https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2019%2F11%2F25%2Fallbirds-amazon-public-private-label-feud" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">
<img alt="" style="display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e865734bf6f7.jpg">

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The holidays can be uncomfortable</strong>–especially at the office party. Jason’s pouring up the eggnog; Alex’s powering up the karaoke machine; the office dog Reginald is seeking shelter behind stacks of unused printer paper.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But <a href="https://my.bombas.com/8-things-sc-morningbrew-a/?utm_source=newsletter&utm_medium=scontent&utm_campaign=morningbrew&utm_content=gif" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Bombas</a> has the answer to your uncomfortable holiday parties:</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The gift of comfortable socks</strong>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Gifting your coworkers <a href="https://my.bombas.com/8-things-sc-morningbrew-a/?utm_source=newsletter&utm_medium=scontent&utm_campaign=morningbrew&utm_content=gif" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Bombas</a> socks spreads comfort through the office from the ground up. <a href="https://my.bombas.com/8-things-sc-morningbrew-a/?utm_source=newsletter&utm_medium=scontent&utm_campaign=morningbrew&utm_content=gif" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Bombas</a> makes comfort for everyone. Running socks for running people. Compression socks for travelers. <a href="https://my.bombas.com/8-things-sc-morningbrew-a/?utm_source=newsletter&utm_medium=scontent&utm_campaign=morningbrew&utm_content=gif" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Bombas</a> will even put their comfy socks in a fancy box for you, and then you can spread <a href="https://my.bombas.com/8-things-sc-morningbrew-a/?utm_source=newsletter&utm_medium=scontent&utm_campaign=morningbrew&utm_content=gif" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Bombas</a> comfort with a fancy <a href="https://my.bombas.com/8-things-sc-morningbrew-a/?utm_source=newsletter&utm_medium=scontent&utm_campaign=morningbrew&utm_content=gif" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Bombas</a> box.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The uncomfortable office party is coming, readers. Spread the Bombas comfort now. And for every pair you purchase, <a href="https://my.bombas.com/8-things-sc-morningbrew-a/?utm_source=newsletter&utm_medium=scontent&utm_campaign=morningbrew&utm_content=gif" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Bombas</a> will donate a pair to someone in need.</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">

</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/11/25/historic-museum-heist-germany?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Historic Museum Heist in Germany
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

<img alt="museum heist in germany " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTc0NzE5NzMyLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Jens Schlueter/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Around 5am local time yesterday, at least two burglars broke into Dresden’s Green Vault, home to some of Europe’s greatest treasures, and made off with at least three sets of "priceless" 18th century jewelry. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">“It’s as if someone broke into the Louvre and had taken the Mona Lisa,” a jewelry historian <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/priceless-baroque-jewels-stolen-in-german-museum-heist-11574694746?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">told the WSJ</a>. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Officials are mourning it as not only a material loss but also a devastating cultural blow to the state of Saxony. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Plus, it’s impossible to estimate the material loss because these items cannot be sold on the open market, German officials </span><span><a href="https://apnews.com/47729e66a3de48059a6350bafe19a3ee?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">told the AP</a></span><span>.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">A team of 20 specialists is on the case. </p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>

PODCAST
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="#" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">

<img alt="business casual logo" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTc0NzI3Mzg5LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">No matter how many times you’ve unsuccessfully explained bitcoin to your friends, you probably don’t even *really* know yourself. And then you pretend to be distracted by your phone when they ask how blockchain technology works. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Let’s fix that.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">This week on Morning Brew’s weekly podcast, </strong><strong style="color:#000"><em>Business Casual</em></strong><strong style="color:#000">,</strong> we’re breaking down everything crypto—from bitcoin’s ride up to $20,000 to Facebook’s misadventures in “reinventing money and transforming the global economy.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><span>Because while crypto memes are big, crypto’s influence on the worldwide financial system could be bigger.</span></p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Is bitcoin really the favored currency of the black market, and if so, does that matter?</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Can Mark Zuckerberg and Facebook deliver on their promise of a new digital currency with Libra, and if so, can we trust it?</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Is “blockchain tech” overhyped, and if so, why do we still fall for the headlines?</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">For all the answers, <em>Business Casual</em> spoke with <a href="https://www.ariannasimpson.com/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Arianna Simpson</a> of Autonomous Partners, an investment fund focused on crypto and digital assets.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Listen now:</strong> <a href="https://link.chtbl.com/Simpson_Apple?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Apple</a> / <a href="https://link.chtbl.com/Simpson_Spotify?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Spotify</a> / <a href="https://link.chtbl.com/Simpson_All?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">everywhere else</a></p>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
</th>
</tr>

670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTc0NzIzNTQ1LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==\"\u003e\n\u003cp Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eFor newsletter writers, a Merger Monday on which companies \u003ca href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/news/stocks/merger-monday-5-companies-announced-more-than-60-billion-deals-2019-11-1028715870?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eannounce\u003c/a\u003e more than $60 billion worth of deals is like when they close the door to the plane and your row is still empty. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSo where to start? Let’s go with the most under-the-radar deal of the day: eBay’s \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-ebay-divestiture/ebay-to-sell-ticketing-unit-stubhub-for-4-05-billion-idUSKBN1XZ1ME?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esale\u003c/a\u003e of online ticketing company StubHub to Swiss ticket reseller Viagogo for $4.1 billion cash.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eMama, I’m coming home \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eViagogo CEO Eric Baker \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2019/11/25/business/stubhub-viagogo-ebay-sale.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecofounded\u003c/a\u003e StubHub in 2000 while at Stanford business school. But after being \u003ca href=\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hNihWir9xzs\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efired\u003c/a\u003e by his business partner, Baker left to start Viagogo in 2006. The next year, StubHub sold to eBay for $310 million.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBaker may not recognize his baby. \u003c/strong\u003eStubHub has become a huge player in the U.S. ticket market, doing $4.8 billion in ticket sales last year. In Q3, it accounted for \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/ebay-nears-deal-to-sell-stubhub-to-viagogo-for-roughly-4-billion-11574688756?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eabout 14%\u003c/a\u003e of eBay revenue. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut StubHub had been on the chopping block for months. In January, activist investors Starboard Value and Elliott Management \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/elliott-management-calls-for-ebay-to-shed-stubhub-classified-ads-business-11548166204?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecalled on eBay\u003c/a\u003e to sell its Classifieds business and StubHub. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eViagogo, you’re up\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe company is a force in the U.K. and continental Europe, offering tickets to popular sports like cricket, rugby, and soccer. But Viagogo keeps finding itself in a scrum of regulatory scrutiny. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eLast November, the U.K.’s Competition and Markets Authority (CMA) secured a \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.gov.uk/government/news/cma-secures-court-order-against-viagogo?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecourt order\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e against Viagogo over concerns it was violating consumer protection law. CMA has since \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.gov.uk/cma-cases/secondary-ticketing-websites?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esuspended preparations\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e for further court action after Viagogo satisfied its concerns. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eAhead of last year's World Cup in Russia, FIFA field a \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://money.cnn.com/2018/06/08/news/companies/world-cup-fifa-ticket-resales/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecriminal complaint\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e against the company for “opaque and deceptive business conduct.” \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture: \u003c/strong\u003eViagogo will need to become squeaky clean considering the market power it’s about to inherit with StubHub (moving \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2019/11/25/business/ebay-stubhub-viagogo-deal/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehundreds of thousands\u003c/a\u003e of tickets per day across 70+ countries). As for eBay, shedding StubHub is step 1 of 100 in resolving a yearslong identity crisis. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" known for subtlety: Camembert, Roquefort, and Bernard Arnault.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe one that won’t assail your tastebuds is the CEO, chairman, and biggest shareholder of LVMH, the world’s largest luxury conglomerate. Yesterday, Arnault \u003ca href=\"https://www.ibtimes.com/bernard-arnault-emperor-luxury-has-tiffany-breakfast-2873077?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebrokered\u003c/a\u003e the biggest-ever deal in luxury when LVMH agreed to buy Tiffany \u0026 Co. for $16.2 billion.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eWith a post-Tiffany-deal \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2019/11/25/investing/bernard-arnault-worlds-richest-jeff-bezos-bill-gates/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003enet worth\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e of more than $106 billion, Arnault is within striking distance of Jeff Bezos and Bill Gates for the title of the world’s richest person.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eMoney does seem to grow on trees when you’re “the godfather of the modern luxury industry,” \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2019/11/25/fashion/bernard-arnault-tiffany-lvmh.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eper the NYT\u003c/a\u003e. LVMH is the parent to a whopping 75 brands, from Dior to Dom Pérignon. LVMH has 3x the market cap of its nearest rival, Kering, and it’s the No. 2 most valuable company in Europe behind Shell.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture: \u003c/strong\u003eConsider Tiffany a starter ring. With Arnault at the head and roughly \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2019/11/24/lvmh-reaches-deal-to-acquire-tiffany-for-16point3-billion.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e$50 billion\u003c/a\u003e in annual revenue, LVMH has moats wide enough to 1) insulate it from potential economic ennui and 2) make mega-dealmaking the new norm.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eCharles Schwab \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2019/11/25/investing/charles-schwab-td-ameritrade/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003econfirmed\u003c/a\u003e Monday it’s buying fellow online brokerage TD Ameritrade for $26 billion. But \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/11/21/schwab-brokers-td-ameritrade-deal?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emaking it official\u003c/a\u003e brings hard questions: Where will we spend Thanksgiving? And will consumers suffer because of our union?\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSure enough, the “behemoth” Schwab/Ameritrade deal is already generating antitrust chatter—after all, the new firm would have $5+ trillion in client assets.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eExecs \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.ft.com/content/fac8a498-0ca7-11ea-bb52-34c8d9dc6d84?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003equickly pointed out\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e that the combined entity would have ~11% of assets in the U.S. retail wealth management industry and only 6% of revenues. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAnd the industry's race to no-fee trading is (theoretically) good for everyday consumers.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut this isn’t just about consumers. Schwab and TD Ameritrade both offer “custodian” services, such as record keeping, to registered investment advisers (RIAs). Schwab owns roughly \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/opinion/articles/2019-11-25/schwab-td-ameritrade-deal-raises-more-than-one-antitrust-concern?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehalf the market\u003c/a\u003e, and TD Ameritrade would tack on another 15%–20% share, per KBW.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eYou can \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-11-21/schwab-ameritrade-faces-tough-antitrust-scrutiny-analysts-say?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecount on\u003c/a\u003e antitrust regulators looking into the deal. But the $26 billion question is whether \u003ca href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/business/2019/11/25/charles-schwab-will-acquire-td-ameritrade-creating-wealth-management-goliath-with-trillion-assets/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eofficials decide\u003c/a\u003e Schwab/Ameritrade’s competition is online brokers or giant width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cem\u003e“We are flattered at the similarities that your private label shoe shares with ours.” \u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn an \u003ca href=\"https://medium.com/@joeyzwillinger/dear-mr-bezos-e691f6d6d705?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eopen letter\u003c/a\u003e to Jeff Bezos yesterday, Joey Zwillinger, cofounder of sustainable shoe startup Allbirds, called out Amazon for \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-11-25/allbirds-calls-out-amazon-for-mimicking-95-wool-sneaker?srnd=markets-vp\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecopying\u003c/a\u003e every part of Allbirds’s Wool Runner shoe—every part but the sustainability.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe backstory: \u003c/strong\u003eAmazon recently \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2019/11/19/business/allbirds-amazon-scrutiny/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ereleased\u003c/a\u003e the Canal Street version of Allbirds’s Wool Runner for less than half the price. It swears that “offering products inspired by the trends to which customers are responding is a common practice across the retail industry.”\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBut Allbirds says something’s missing: \u003c/strong\u003eAmazon isn't using the open-sourced, sustainable tech Allbirds has shared with 100+ brands.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eZwillinger to Bezos: “You can use it. We \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cem\u003ewant \u003c/em\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eyou to use it...With the help of your immense scale, the cost of this material will come down for all users.”\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eTrying to convince Amazon and its sprawling collection of 1,000+ private label successes to adopt Allbirds’s sustainable habits won’t be easy, but neither is avoiding a tech bro
